sen.e: Rankoku Genjo (1653 ~ May 31, 1707) is a priest of Rinzaisei-sect Obaku-ha (Obaku Sect) of the early Edo period.

sen.j: 号 (称号)が蘭谷で、名が元定である。

sen.e: While he was born as a son of a clothing shop in Kyoto, and he was visiting Mt. Obaku following his father, he became a disciple of Gettan Docho, an attendant of Ingen at the age of 15 in 1667.

sen.e: In accordance with that Gettan became the 2nd chief priest of Jikishi-an Temple in Sagano, Kyoto, Genjo became the shuso (the leader of monks practicing asceticism) and began to live in Gangyokuken in the Mt. Obaku.

sen.e: While his master Gettan mourned the death of his beloved disciple, and said "he was good at many arts" in the ceremonial message, Genjo was actually superior in paintings, tenkoku and sculpture.
